snippet: Negotiators for the State Legislature entered intense talks with Gov. Pete Wilson's staff today to resolve a dispute over future state support for public schools, the last remaining hurdle to ending California's two-month budget crisis.   People o...
lead_paragraph: Negotiators for the State Legislature entered intense talks with Gov. Pete Wilson's staff today to resolve a dispute over future state support for public schools, the last remaining hurdle to ending California's two-month budget crisis. People on both sides familiar with the negotiations said they were trying to find some face-saving concessions to offer Speaker Willie L. Brown Jr. and the fractious Democratic-controlled Assembly as inducement to vote for the main elements of the Republican Governor's plan.
